com.att.research.xacmlatt.pdp.policy

Class ObligationExpression

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.att.research.xacmlatt.pdp.policy.ObligationExpression
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    DOMObligationExpression

    public class ObligationExpression
extends java.lang.Object
    ObligationExpression extends PolicyComponent to implement the XACML ObligationExpression element.
    Version:
    $Revision: 1.1 $
    Author:
    car

      • evaluate

        public Obligation evaluate(EvaluationContext evaluationContext,
                  PolicyDefaults policyDefaults)
                    throws EvaluationException
        Evaluates this ObligationExpression in the given EvaluationContext to get an Obligation to include in a PDP result.
        Parameters:
        evaluationContext - the EvaluationContext in which to evaluate this ObligationExpression
        policyDefaults - the PolicyDefaults to apply to the evaluation
        Returns:
        a new Obliagion from this ObligationExpression
        Throws:
        EvaluationException - if there is an error evaluating any of the AttributeAssignmentExpressions

      • evaluate

      • getStatusMessage

        public java.lang.String getStatusMessage()
        Gets the String status message associated with this PolicyComponent.
        Returns:

      • setStatus

        public void setStatus(StatusCode statusCodeIn,
             java.lang.String messageIn)
        Sets the StatusCode and String status message for this PolicyComponent. This method is mainly provided for objects that may have lazy evaluations performed on them, in which case the status is not determined until the object is actually used.
        Parameters:
        statusCodeIn - the StatusCode for this PolicyComponent
        messageIn - the String status message for this PolicyComponent

      • isOk

        public boolean isOk()
        Does a check on the StatusCode for this element to determine if it is equivalent to the OK status code.
        Returns:
        true if the StatusCode is equivalent to OK, otherwise false

      • validate

        public boolean validate()
        If a StatusCode has not been set, ask this PolicyComponent to validate itself and return the value from the validation. Otherwise, check to see if the cached StatusCode indicates this PolicyComponent is valid.
        Returns:
        true if this PolicyComponent is valid, else false.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
